### **User Prompt:**

Develop a Chrome extension that interprets finger gestures (as shown in the attached video) to enable window scrolling. Outline the necessary components and framework for this project.

### **![][image1]Thinking:**

#### **Defining Gesture Recognition**

I'm starting by analyzing the user's video to pinpoint the exact finger gestures for scrolling. Then, I will develop a solid plan for all the different parts of the project needed. I'm focusing on breaking down the process into actionable steps.

#### **Crafting a Development Roadmap**

I've zeroed in on the specifics of the user's video, specifically the finger movements used for scrolling. My focus now is on creating a solid development roadmap. This includes building a computer vision model, along with a Chrome extension. I'm also planning out the frameworks and libraries I'll need, like TensorFlow.js. Finally, I'll organize my plan clearly so you can easily understand my approach.

### **Response:**
